nodes.text: How's it going?
Great - I'm working on my latest song for Sophia.

Sophia... you've stolen my heart, I'm falling apart without you,
Sophia... please tell me I rate, to go out on a date rendezvous, honey, do.
Feeling a little melon-choly, eh?
I'll re-fruit your statement by saying I'm berry happy. Sophia and I make a grape pear.
You ready to meet with Sophia tomorrow?
I can't wait for the new day. The minutes seem like hours, the hours go so slowly... and yet it's still tonight. Oh Sophia, your sight, will turn these endless hours into delight.
I'm sure she'll be impressed with your enthusiasm.
Do you have to make a musical production out of everything?

options.text: Talk About the Letter on the Bed

nodes.text: What do you know about this letter on my bed?
It was on your bed when I came back from supper. I just assumed you had left it there.
It's weird. This letter isn't to me - it's to my mother from some uncle I never even heard of before. I think it was written years ago after my father died when I was a baby.
So who would put an old letter on your bed?
I don't know, but I'd like to find out.
Try to get some sleep so you can be fresh for Sophia.
If I'm too fresh, I'll probably get slapped.
How are you feeling?
I'm kinda numb right now. I can't write music, I can't play my instruments. Sophia was my muse.
I'm told it only hurts for a little while.
That's what they tell me.
Forget about Sophia. You need more than a pretty face in your life.You need someone who has your quirky sense of humor and love of music.
Yeah well, I need someone who doesn't think I'm ugly and stupid. I'm not sure that there is someone out there for me.
I don't think you're ugly and stupid. Funny-looking yeah, crazy maybe, but those are good things.
Right.

options.text: Talk About the Letter on the Bed

nodes.text: What do you know about this letter on my bed?
My life is ending. Nothing matters anymore.
It's weird. This letter isn't to me - it's to my mother from some uncle I never even heard of before. I think it was written years ago after my father died when I was a baby.
At least you had a mother who loves you.
Try to get some rest. Who knows, maybe you'll meet your real dream girl tomorrow.
There will never be another woman in my life like Sophia. I'm not going to be able to sleep a wink thinking about her.
How are things going with you?
I'm still working up my nerve to speak with her tomorrow. I'm writing notes on what to say so that I don't bite my tongue when I open my mouth.
Don't worry, Aeolus - you're a great performer. You'll do fine.

nodes.message: Out of time to talk to Sophia.

nodes.text: I didn't manage to see Sophia today, sorry.
It's okay. I can talk to her myself tomorrow, after class.
Sophia is gorgeous - I can see why you are so hooked by her. She thinks you are cute. She can't wait to hear your wonderful songs about her. You should go there tomorrow and sing them for her.
Wonderful! I'll do that as soon as I finish them. Thank you so much for your help. You are my best bud.
You know that the sooner you talk to Sophia, the better you'll feel.
Yeah, I know.
I'll talk to her tomorrow after I get out of class.
Good luck with Sophia - you'll do great.

options.text: Talk About the Letter on the Bed

nodes.text: What do you know about this letter on my bed?
It was on your bed when I came back from supper. I just assumed you had left it there.
It's weird. This letter isn't to me - it's to my mother from some uncle I never even heard of before. I think it was written years ago after my father died when I was a baby.
So who would put an old letter on your bed?
I don't know, but I'd like to find out.
Sweet dreams, Aeolus.
All my dreams of Sophia have turned to nightmares.
I'll dream of Sophia. Nothing could be sweeter than she is.
